title: Request for Complaints Lodged Against Landlords in New York City

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Complaints lodged against landlords in New York City from January 1st, 2019 to the present time, for all boroughs including the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, and Staten Island.

I am specifically requesting complaints that are not accessible on the NYC open data website. This includes any complaints that may be under review or pending investigation and have not yet been made public.

The requested documents should include, but not limited to, the following information:

Date of the complaint
Location of the property (including the borough and the street address)
Description of the alleged issue(s) reported in the complaint
Current status of the complaint (i.e., resolved, under review, pending investigation, etc.)
Type of action taken by the authorities, if any (i.e., citation, warning, fine, etc.)
Any follow-up actions taken by the authorities, if applicable (i.e., additional inspections, reprimands, etc.)
To protect the privacy of individuals involved, I request that any sensitive information regarding the complainant be redacted from the provided documents. However, I do not wish for any other information to be withheld, deleted, or redacted.

As you may know, the Freedom of Information Act provides the public with the right to access information held by government agencies. To support my request, I would like to cite several court cases that have recognized this right, including New York Times Co. v. United States, 403 U.S. 713 (1971), NLRB v. Robbins Tire & Rubber Co., 437 U.S. 214 (1978), and County of Suffolk v. Long Island Lighting Co., 710 N.Y.S.2d 846 (N.Y. App. Div. 2000).

I would appreciate it if you could provide me with the requested information in a digital format, such as a CSV or Excel spreadsheet, sent via email or a secure file sharing platform.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of the arrest on Feb 6, 2023 of Shamus Sebastian Chapman.
DOB 08/06/1983.
Physical description:
6'5", weighing approx 240 lbs.
Black curly hair, balding on top.
Hazel eyes.
Well spoken. Extensive vocabulary.
I also want to know where my son is being housed. Why has he had no court date as of today? Why is there no photo of him on his arrest record from DeKalb Country Georgia jail?
Why has my son not called me? I have put money on his phone account and commissary account. Both are not being used. Why are they not being used?
I am Shamus Sebastian Chapman's mother, Shirley R Loggins, I have the right to know that my son, who is in your custody, is well and safe not dead like the prisoner in Clayton County.
April 18, 2023
Shirley R Loggins

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shiobhvan

communications.subject: Montana Freedom of Information Act Request: Montana Commissary Price List- April 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Montana Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current price listss for commissary items and other products for inmate purchase within facilities under the jurisdiction of this agency.

Please provide materials for the following location and any other under the jurisdiction of this agency:
-Montana's Women's Prison

If you have questions about this request, please call 239-778-7008

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Karen Fernandez-Rua
